definitions: The act of scooping water out of a boat or other vessel.
The act of making regular payments to a court of law in order to secure the release of an accused person.
The act of packaging hay or other material into bales.
The act of abandoning a difficult situation or person.
examples: He was bailing water out of the canoe.
They are bailing him out of jail.
The farmers are bailing hay in the fields.
She was bailing on her friends again.
